content: crocheted acrobatic scarf adapted from the harmony guides 300 crochet stitches volume 6 by cindy abernethy materials approximately 300 yards yarn size i crochet hook sample uses 2 skeins 300 yards of malabrigo silky merino stitch key chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble dtr = treble_crochet finished size approximately 5 x 52 unblocked 7 x70 blocked gauge not really important -- it s a scarf ☺ sample gauge is 5 double_crochet = 1 unblocked pattern worked over a multiple of 6 stitches + 1 add 2 more for base chain chain 21 for base chain 6x3 +1=19 +2 more for base chain = 21 row 1 work 2 double_crochet into 3rd chain from hook *chain 4 skip 5 chain 5 double_crochet into next chain * repeat from * ending by working only 3 double_crochet at end of row turn row 2 chain 2 counts as first double_crochet skip first three stitches *work a group of 3 double_crochet 3 chain 3 double_crochet into next 4-chain arch ** skip next 5 double_crochet repeat from * ending last repeat at ** skip 2 double_crochet 1 double_crochet into top of turning chain turn row 3 chain 6 counts as 1 dtr and 1 chain 5 double_crochet into next 3-chain arch ** 4 chain repeat from * ending last repeat at ** 1 chain 1 dtr into top of turning chain turn row 4 chain 5 counts as 1 treble_crochet and and 1 chain 3 double_crochet into next 1-chain space *skip 5 double_crochet work a group of 3 double_crochet 3 chain 3 double_crochet into next 4-chain arch repeat from * ending skip 5 double_crochet work group of 3 double_crochet 1 chain 1 treble_crochet into turning chain turn copyright © 2008 cindy abernethy all rights reserved page 1 of 2 row 5 chain 3 counts as 1 double_crochet 2 double_crochet into next 1-chain space *4 chain 5 double_crochet into next 3-chain arch repeat from * ending 4 chain 3 double_crochet into turning chain turn repeat row 2 through 5 until scarf is approximately 52 long or as long as you d like to make it end by working either row 3 or row 5 do not turn edging chain 1 work single_crochet along long edge of scarf evenly spacing stitches so that the edge stays straight when you reach a corner work 3 single_crochet in corner then continue with single_crochet edging to next corner when you have gone around all three edges work 2 additional single_crochet in same space where you started to create the final corner break yarn pull end through to secure weave in ends scarf can be worn immediately or blocked depending on your own preference copyright © 2008 cindy abernethy all rights reserved page
